net.zerobandwidth.android.lib.services

Class SimpleServiceConnection<S extends android.app.Service>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.zerobandwidth.android.lib.services.SimpleServiceConnection<S>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ServiceConnection
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SimpleTestServiceConnection

    public class SimpleServiceConnection<S extends android.app.Service>
extends java.lang.Object
implements android.content.ServiceConnection
    This class provides a simple, consistent implementation of a service binding, so that neither the service nor the consumer of that service is required to have its own implementation. The class provides basic methods to bind to, and unbind from, the service; get the bound instance of the service; bind as a listener to the connection itself. Note: In version 0.1.0 (#19), the class's members and inner classes were fundamentally modified to provide tighter access to the connected service class. While this makes the class more convenient to use, it is a flag day beyond which consumers of this class will need to be modified to catch up.
    Since:
    zerobandwidth-net/android 0.0.1 (#1)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  SimpleServiceConnection.InstanceBinder<BS extends android.app.Service>
      The binder provided by the service needs to implement this interface, which provides us with a standard way to reach into the service's own public methods.
      static interface  SimpleServiceConnection.Listener<LS extends android.app.Service>
      Because connections can take a while, the object that is waiting for the connection to be completed should implement this interface to receive a signal when the connection is established.

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_BINDING_FLAGS

        public static final int DEFAULT_BINDING_FLAGS
        By default, the connection will bind at a level above the consumer, and auto-create the service if it has not yet been started. Used by the class's connect(android.content.Context, int) methods in absence of any flag set specified by the caller.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • getLogTag

        protected final java.lang.String getLogTag()
        For log messages generated by methods of this class, or any descendant class, use this method, which examines the class of the instance from which it is called, and returns that class's simple name. This allows other projects to extend this class without having to override this method.
        Returns:
        a logging tag for this connection object

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true iff the specified class is the bound service's class

      • isBound

        public boolean isBound()
        Indicates whether the connection is bound.
        Returns:
        an indication that the service is bound

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Perhaps more useful than isBound(), this function verifies not only that the connection is bound, but also that the persistent reference to the service is not null.
        Returns:
        an indication that the connection is, indeed, connected
        Since:
        zerobandwidth-net/android 0.0.1 (#5)

      • getServiceInstance

        public S getServiceInstance()
        Accessor for the service instance, if the connection is bound.
        Returns:
        the bound instance of the service, if any

      • connect

        public SimpleServiceConnection<S> connect(android.content.Context ctx,
                                          int bmFlags)
                                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Attempts to connect to the service. The caller should not process the return value of this method immediately in order to access the service; rather, it should handle the consequences of the connection by implementing SimpleServiceConnection.Listener.onServiceConnected(net.zerobandwidth.android.lib.services.SimpleServiceConnection<LS>).
        Parameters:
        ctx - the context in which to bind to the service
        bmFlags - a mask of optional binding flags; see Context
        Returns:
        the connection, for fluid invocations
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the context is null

      • connect

        public SimpleServiceConnection<S> connect(android.content.Context ctx)
        Attempts to connect to the service, using the default binding control flags. The caller should not process the return value of this method immediately in order to access the service; rather, it should handle the consequences of the connection by implementing SimpleServiceConnection.Listener.onServiceConnected(net.zerobandwidth.android.lib.services.SimpleServiceConnection<LS>).
        Parameters:
        ctx - the context in which to bind to the service
        Returns:
        the connection, for fluid invocations
        See Also:
        DEFAULT_BINDING_FLAGS

      • disconnect

        public SimpleServiceConnection<S> disconnect(android.content.Context ctx)
        Attempts to break the connection to the service. Methods that tear down the context in which the service was started (such as Activity.onStop()) should call this method to free the service binding. The caller should not assume that the binding was successfully released; any other consequences of releasing this binding should be handled by implementing SimpleServiceConnection.Listener.onServiceDisconnected(net.zerobandwidth.android.lib.services.SimpleServiceConnection<LS>).
        Parameters:
        ctx - the context in which the binding should be broken
        Returns:
        the connection, for fluid invocations

      • onServiceConnected

        public void onServiceConnected(android.content.ComponentName cn,
                               android.os.IBinder binder)
        Called by the Android OS when a the service accepts the connection's binding. Notifies all of the connection's listeners that the binding has been completed.
        Specified by:
        onServiceConnected in interface android.content.ServiceConnection
        Parameters:
        cn - the name of the service component
        binder - a binder to the service

      • onServiceDisconnected

        public void onServiceDisconnected(android.content.ComponentName cn)
        Called by the Android OS when a connection's binding to the service must be broken. Notifies all of the connection's listeners that the binding has been broken.
        Specified by:
        onServiceDisconnected in interface android.content.ServiceConnection
        Parameters:
        cn - the name of the service component
